alert.note: Alert for Hampden (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 10 at 10:07PM EDT until further notice by NWS Boston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Massachusetts...Connecticut... Connecticut River At Montague affecting Hampshire and Franklin Counties. Connecticut River Below Holyoke affecting Hampden County. Connecticut River At Northampton affecting Hampshire and Hampden Counties. Connecticut River ABOVE Holyoke Dam affecting Hampden County. Connecticut River At Thompsonville affecting Hampden and Hartford Counties. Connecticut River At Hartford affecting Middlesex and Hartford Counties. Farmington River At Simsbury affecting Hartford County. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Massachusetts... Deerfield At Charlemont affecting Berkshire and Franklin Counties. West Deerfield River AT West Deerfield affecting Franklin County. For the Connecticut River...including Montague, Northampton, Holyoke Dam, Holyoke, Springfield, Thompsonville, Hartford, Middle Haddam... Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Farmington River...including Unionville, Simsbury, Tariffville...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Deerfield River...including Charlemont, West Deerfield... Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Connecticut River at Thompsonville. * WHEN...From late tonight until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Significant and widespread flooding along the river can be expected from the Massachusetts towns of Agawam and Longmeadow, through the northern Connecticut towns of Suffield and Enfield. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 PM EDT Monday the stage was 13.0 feet. - Bankfull stage is 5.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tonight and continue rising to a crest of 17.7 feet early Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 17.8 feet on 03/15/1977. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Tuesday morning at 1015 AM EDT.
